title: Requirements Gathering for Immutable State Management System
description: Gather and document project requirements from stakeholders. This task involves identifying functional and non-functional requirements, necessary components, performance metrics, security considerations, and other relevant specifications. Additionally, it's important to consider the system's scalability, extensibility, and compatibility with existing technologies.

title: Design Architecture
description: Develop the high-level design architecture for the ImmutableStateManagementSystem, including data structures and pure functions.

title: Database Design
description: Design the database schema for storing and managing immutable state data.

title: Backend Implementation - Core System
description: Implement the core functionality of the ImmutableStateManagementSystem, including state transition logic and data persistence.

title: Frontend Implementation - UI & Integration
description: Develop the user interface and integrate it with the core system for seamless state management.

title: Testing
description: Perform functional and unit tests to ensure the correctness and performance of the ImmutableStateManagementSystem. Tests will cover all possible state transitions, edge cases, and compatibility with existing systems. Include regression testing for backtracking and recovery scenarios.

title: Deployment and Documentation of ImmutableStateManagementSystem
description: Deploy the ImmutableStateManagementSystem to production environments, document its usage, best practices, and provide a tutorial for implementation. This includes setting up the system, integrating it with existing applications, troubleshooting common issues, testing, security considerations, performance optimization, and a section dedicated to collaboration with technical writer during this process. The documentation should also cover sections on setup, integration, troubleshooting, testing, security, performance, and collaboration. To ensure the quality of the documentation, it is recommended that the technical writer collaborates closely throughout the process. Additionally, break down the task into smaller, manageable sub-tasks for efficient execution. Once the task is decomposed, assign relevant sub-tasks to appropriate team members (e.g., DevOps for deployment, Frontend/Backend developers for integration, Security Specialist for security considerations, etc.).
